summary: This bill, the Wastewater Infrastructure Pollution Prevention and Environmental Safety Act (WIPPES Act), mandates 'Do Not Flush' labeling for certain premoistened, nonwoven disposable wipes sold at retail. The labeling requirements specify how the label notice and symbol must be displayed based on packaging type to increase visibility. It also prohibits flushability representations, enforces through the Federal Trade Commission, preempts conflicting state laws, and defines key terms, taking effect one year after enactment.
